title: Recognizing and Managing Radiation Sickness
brief: How to identify and manage symptoms of acute radiation exposure.
steps: Step 1: Recognize symptoms: nausea, diarrhea, vomiting, fatigue, weakness, and hair loss.
Step 2: Do not panic if you experience these symptoms - small doses can cause them temporarily.
Step 3: Rest as much as possible while in shelter to aid recovery.
Step 4: Maintain fluid intake to prevent dehydration from vomiting and diarrhea.
Step 5: Take any available medicine that prevents vomiting.
Step 6: Maintain food intake when possible to support recovery.
Step 7: Practice rigorous personal hygiene to prevent infections.
Step 8: Cover eyes with improvised goggles to prevent particle entry.
warnings: There is no first aid treatment for radiation sickness itself.
Main danger is secondary infection due to compromised immune system.
Severity and speed of symptom onset indicates degree of radiation damage.
Body becomes extremely sensitive to infections due to blood chemistry changes.
